title: Solid code editor
pros: I've been using VS Code for a number of years now and it handles almost anything I've thrown it, after a number of key extensions have been installed.
cons: Some basic features missing that extensions are required for but this is improving over time. The extension community is very vast however.

title: VSCode review
review_text: Good experience .I use it daily .I my go to IDE .I use it for web and mobile development .Mainly because of its extensions and plugins
pros: The best IDE out there  . Huge ecosystem support , plugins , extensions , etc . Great for web and mobile development
cons: It has lots of telemetry is a little slow compare to other alternatives.However pros are more than const by far

title: A fast, flexible and developer Friendly code editor
review_text: It has been positive. I have completed quite reasonable projects using it. It makes coding efficient and enjoyable
pros: It works smoothly in any project size, has tons of extensions that make it fit exactly how I like yo work
cons: Sometimes managing all the plugins and updates feels a bit messy and few setting could be tricky to find

title: Easy, flexible, and extensible
review_text: Overall VS code is a great tool.  I use it for multiple software development languages and it does a great job support each one.
pros: VS Code is so easy to install and start using.  And it has a multiple of plugins available to enhance the tool to make your software development experience better.
cons: Its built-in integration with git is pretty basic; I find my self using a terminal window and the git command line more often.

title: The best IDE, full stop.
reviewer_role: Member of Technical Staff in Canada
review_text: Great software that I work with every single day. I have used VSCode to replace JetBrains product suite and never looked back. Great extension integration, and easily integrates with everything imaginable. At Cerebras we have built tooling tightly integrated with VSCode and it is our default development tool.
pros: Phenomenal product. Great integration with Github and all AI coding assistant, great flow when I want to add an extension and works flawlessly with any programming languages, eco system, or platforms.
cons: Very hard to reach out to people from microsoft when there is bug; most VSCode internal plugins like Pylance are still close sourced. Difficult to track down bug when it is inside one of the binaries. VSCode SSH / container plugin needs more work, it still frequently disconnect for me for no obvious reason.

title: Aimlessly Impressive
review_text: Code snippets, small projects, debugging tasks, and compiling. Cross scripting projects and code safe keeping.
pros: It comes out of the box with a ton of useful features making the process of getting your project up and running effortlessly.
cons: A lot to take in at once for new comers. Can be a bit overwhelming getting comfortable with all the features.

title: Versitile and powerful IDE
review_text: It is a very good IDE that is great for a bunch of different workflows and uses. It is highly configurable, and that makes it very good for coding.
pros: It is very versatile for code editing; it supports a bunch of different languages and is very accessible.
cons: It isn't as powerful as some heavier IDEs, since it doesn't always have the full feature suite that other programs have.
